intro: Cardopatium fontanesii, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
